results.title: Touring Australia
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Kestrel Films (Australia), John Richardson and Eddie Moses
results.brief_description: An informative and entertaining film that combines an overall perspective of Australia with fascinating stories that relate to special places, individuals, events and recreational activities. These stories form the fabric of the film, stories about the historic Rocks area of Sydney, the Great Barrier Reef, the colourful Ghan railway, the mystical Ayers Rock and the world-famous Sydney Opera House. Touring Australia touches on Australia’s history - colonial heritage, the struggle for independence and unique position beside the states of Asia. It also shows the timelessness of its land mass, special animals and the blending of many cultures. We see the great modern cities of Australia, the enchanting wilderness places from Kakadu to the Top End.

results.title: Toulouse Lautrec
results.creator_credit: Peter Riethof and Peter Riethof Productions
results.brief_description: Dramatises the life of the French artist, Toulouse Lautrec. His paintings and sketches are used to portray his youth, background, adult life, physical handicaps and the world of Paris cafes, nightclubs and theatres in which he lived. Lautrec recorded the Paris scene in pitiless detail in his sketches, paintings, and lithographed posters; Sarah Bernhardt at the Comedi Francaise; La Goulou, dancing the can-can; scenes in the midnight clubs - the seamier side of Paris; the ruined absinthe drinkers; the prostitutes and the midinettes.

results.title: Tough on two wheels
results.creator_credit: Film Partnership and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Motor-cycles and the people who ride them, showing the variety of ways in which motor-cycles are used in Britain from everyday uses for business and pleasure to the thrills of the speedway and the Wall of Death. Includes sequences of the Isle of Man, T.T., Silverstone and the 1954 International Six Days Trial.

results.title: Tough at the top: business management styles
results.creator_credit: Robyn Holdsworth, Image Link and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: This program features five short acted scenarios demonstrating different business management styles. Each situation is analysed and the likely outcomes of each management approach is examined. Also highlighted is the issue that each manager is different and that no manager uses only one of these styles - they adopt different styles based on the circumstances of each situation faced. Management styles discussed include: consultative; laissez-faire; autocratic; participative and persuasive. Video support notes included. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary students.

results.title: Touch your toes & around we go
results.brief_description: Outlines and illustrates the perceived advantages of a multicultural approach to music and movement for preschool children, in a child care environment, especially those who use English as a second language. Appropriate for Professional Development (Home Economics) at VCE level. No other credits available.

results.title: Touch wood
results.creator_credit: T.P. Deamer, Castlereagh and W.J. Pearson
results.brief_description: Presents a 1960’s perspective of Australian Timber development: The many possibilities available in the use of timber in the construction and interior decoration of private homes. Described in a fairy tale idiom. Narrated by Roger Climpson.
